page.title: 08WATER
page.content:
Mains water is laid on to all the houses in the area. The houses are fed from a cast-iron{main}laid in the 1930's to feed the Lion standpipes, which were placed at strategic points, such as the Chapel, Middle Farm, Lamb's Cottage and the Granaries. The {standpipe}at the Chapel is still there but could not be persuaded to produce water as it had seized up from lack of use. Water was previously a problem in the area in hot weather because the area is relatively high and{wells}soon dried up.
Mains{sewers,}installed in 1983, run into a sump at the site of one of the old wells near Church Farm. It is pumped from there to a treatment plant adjoining Sharnbrook road railway bridge.
